messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:29): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: i assume you meant <foreignObject> not <foreignContent>

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:32): hsivonen: i don't really understand how a flag for foreign content would work. Wouldn't it just be like having a second "state" which was either "foreign" or "whatever the secondary mode is", with the secondary mode being what the insertion mode is now?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:32): what's the benefit of doing it that way?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:33): it seems like you end up with an extra "if" statement per token
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:35): is failing to work out what to write as a final sentence of his Englsih dissertation
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:36): i recommend not writing it like that sentence
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:36): That, on the whole, is a good idea.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:50): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Yes, I meant foreignObject
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:50): i replied to the e-mail
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:51): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Yeah, I saw, thanks
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:55): Tip for browser developers: if search can't find a string in a document, it probably also won't finda longer string for which that is a substring
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:59): Woo. html5lib passes the tiny number of foreign content tests
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:59): (it turned out that the least bug was a missing break statement)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:09): This is horrible.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:10): How can I end 4,500 words?
0c25ae3066f1b9f7890ceff405fdcab1 (22:11): "Rocks fall, everbody dies"?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:17): "And then I woke up."
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:21): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: What is the second-to-last sentence?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:22): well, provided the absolute final paragraph doesn't become more than one sentence:

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:22): "The outcome of the other loves and lusts of Van are never given, though may well be equally morbid. Lucette's suicide does not stop Van and Ada's love: it brings them back together after their father banishing them from each other, for their love to continue unabated, with all the passion it had prior to their separation."
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:23): You could replace the ':' with a '.', and then your second-to-last sentence would become two sentences and therefore would provide the last sentence.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:23): That would only make a statement about one of the three texts though
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:24): Alternatively go with "Which would never happen in reality, so proving how silly the whole thing is."
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:25): (Actully it sounds like you could just stop it there. Unless you were tring to make some oher point in which case you should consider mentioning that)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:26): This is why I dislike several hundred word conclusions: I never know how to conclude them.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:29): I dislike what I just wrote as it results in a final page with one word.

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:29): "The destructiveness of the relationships within all three novels is ultimately caused by the idealistically perfect love that the protagonists thrive upon: in an age-old romantic novel, love would prevail; in these novels, all does not end well."
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:30): Right, now at 5,339 words.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:31): (Limit is 4,500)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:47): Hello
254ed0230d4269287210190adfbfa570 (22:47): can you tell me where should i find ui experts who knows faceted classification?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:48): can't, since he has no idea what it is
254ed0230d4269287210190adfbfa570 (22:49): http://flamenco.berkeley.edu
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:49): This probably isn't the right channel for that kind of thing
254ed0230d4269287210190adfbfa570 (22:50): yes, that's why i asked
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:56): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: If you have to cut 1000 words, it seems silly to worry about the aesthetics of the final page layout at this stage :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:56): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: That's why I'm not caring at this stage :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:56): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I also need to reset the entire thing in Times New Roman, 12pt, ragged right, for some reason best known to the SQA.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:56): 254ed0230d4269287210190adfbfa570: why do you think this channel is the right place to find the people who do know abou that kind of thing?

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:56): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Also: start cutting words and then reread the ending. Once you have condensed your essay and reduced the repetition, you you will have a much clearer idea of what your essay is about and how to summarise it
